title: When Vinod Khanna spoke about his rivalry with Big B
description: Vinod Khanna and Amitabh Bachchan entered Bollywood in the late 1960s during Rajesh Khanna's reign. As Amitabh rose with hits like Zanjeer, Vinod gained prominence through villainous roles. Their rivalry became apparent in films like Zameer and Hera Pheri, while their partnership thrived until Vinod decided to join Rajneesh’s ashram.

title: War 2: Kiara-Ayan twin in white in Italy - PICS
description: Kiara Advani shared a selfie with War 2 director Ayan Mukerji, exciting fans as they twinned in white during a 'Holy Sunday.' The photo, set to Wake Up Sid's Iktara, delighted fans online. War 2, directed by Mukerji, is set to release on August 14, 2025, continuing YRF’s spy universe.

title: Aamir Khan on Amitabh Bachchan's 82nd birthday
description: Amitabh Bachchan will turn 82 on October 11. The recent promo video of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' Season 16 featured a grand birthday celebration for Big B. The unwavering love from fans and participants made the actor visibly emotional. Aamir Khan also shared some valuable memories about Amitabh on this special occasion.

title: Varun-Shraddha-Kriti, Salim-Javed, PC-Malti: Top 5 news
description: In entertainment today, Varun Dhawan, Shraddha Kapoor, and Kriti Sanon may join Stree X Bhediya, while FIR writer Amit Aryan claims Salim-Javed plagiarized. Priyanka Chopra shared sweet moments with daughter Malti Marie on the Citadel 2 set. Saif Ali Khan returns for Race 4, and Ajay Devgn's fierce Singham Again look excites fans.

title: When Big B reacted to reports of Aishwarya being manglik
description: When Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan married in 2007, they encountered numerous baseless rumors, including claims that Aishwarya brought misfortune. Amitabh Bachchan later criticized this gossip, stressing the importance of their marital bond over public speculation. Today, the couple has a teenage daughter, Aaradhya, and lives in Mumbai with the Bachchan family.

title: Sujoy recalls Big B's support while making Kahaani
description: Sujoy Ghosh is known for the success of the Vidya Balan-starrer 'Kahaani', but he had a tough time with the box office failure of 'Aladin', starring Amitabh Bachchan, Riteish Deshmukh, and Jacqueline Fernandez in key roles. The director recently revealed that Amitabh stood by his side during those difficult times and offered support for his next venture.

title: Salman to cameo as Chulbul Pandey in Singham Again
description: Salman Khan is keeping his promise to Rohit Shetty about joining Singham Again as Chulbul Pandey. While he hasn't shot his scenes yet, he’s set to start soon. The film also stars Akshay Kumar, Ranveer Singh, Tiger Shroff, Kareena Kapoor Khan, and Deepika Padukone, expanding the popular Singham franchise.

title: Amar Kaushik on directing SRK and Salman
description: Bollywood director Amar Kaushik shares that his family measures his success by potential collaborations with superstars Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan. Despite their enthusiasm, Kaushik focuses on creating unique and heartfelt films, especially for younger audiences, while respecting the Khans’ massive fanbase.

title: Prakash caused Rs 1 Crore loss: Producer Vinod
description: Prakash Raj shared a photo with Tamil Nadu's Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin and Chief Minister MK Stalin on X (formerly Twitter). Producer S. Vinod Kumar accused Raj of causing a ₹1 crore loss by leaving a film set without notice. Raj has not responded to the claim. Social media buzzes with speculation about the incident.

title: Bobby Deol: A Journey from Stardom to Reinvention
description: Bobby Deol's career, which began with a promising debut in 'Barsaat,' faced ups and downs over the years. After fading stardom, his resurgence came through digital platforms like Netflix's 'Class of '83' and the web series 'Aashram.' Now, he has reestablished himself with Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Animal and has become the most sought after actors in antagonist roles be it Alpha, Thalapathy 69,and Kanguva.

title: When Vidya Balan said she does not understand open marriage
description: Vidya Balan expresses her opinion against open relationships, stating she values monogamy and cannot understand the concept of sharing a partner. Despite her personal stance, she does not judge others who find such relationships suitable. "I abhor this concept of open relationship. If it works for you, great, but I cannot fathom how it works for someone," she said. She is set to return in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' releasing in November.

title: Dimple Kapadia’s granddaughter Naomika takes internet by storm
description: Naomika Saran, granddaughter of Dimple Kapadia, is creating a buzz online with her captivating pictures. At 19, she is admired for her beauty and charm. She is often seen with her cousin Aarav, son of Twinkle Khanna and Akshay Kumar. Fans eagerly await any news of her Bollywood debut. You cannot miss the pictures of Noamika Saran. Take a look inside.

title: ASTRO have emotional reunion after 2 years
description: During the 'Dusk Till Dawn' fan meeting, ASTRO members Cha Eun Woo, MJ, and Jinjin surprised Sanha, creating an emotional moment with fans. They reminisced and performed their signature group greeting after two years. ASTRO launched a special digital single 'Circles' to mark their 8th anniversary.

title: Will Varun- Shraddha-Kriti come together in Stree x Bhediya film?
description: Varun Dhawan and Shraddha Kapoor's chemistry in 'Stree 2' song 'Khoobsurat' is winning hearts. Director Amar Kaushik hints at a possible romantic storyline involving characters from 'Stree' and 'Bhediya.' 'Stree 2' enjoys box office success while fans speculate on future installments. Rajkummar Rao confirms plans for 'Stree 3' with a promising concept.

title: Mathew Thomas praises Vijay’s punctuality
description: Mollywood actor Mathew Thomas expresses admiration for Thalapathy Vijay’s punctuality after working together in Lokesh Kanagaraj’s action film 'Leo'. Thomas is inspired by Vijay’s disciplined schedule and respectful behavior on set. Despite celebrating a crew member’s birthday until 2 am, Vijay was on set by 7 am the next morning, showcasing his commitment. Thomas' latest movie is the sports drama 'Cup', and he made a cameo appearance in the hit film 'Premalu'.

title: When SRK shared his kids were ‘better human beings’ than him
description: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan, known for his humility, acknowledges that his children, Aryan, Suhana, and AbRam, are better human beings. Supporting their own aspirations, he did not guide them towards acting or engineering. Suhana has launched her acting career, while Aryan explores directing.

title: Prabhudeva-Nayanthara's relationship led to his divorce
description: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan are a celebrated couple in showbiz, but Nayanthara’s previous relationship with Prabhudeva, which led to his divorce, had garnered significant attention. Their breakup was challenging, and although neither discussed the reasons, both have moved on with their lives.

title: Shraddha’s AWKWARD ramp walk leaves netizens divided
description: Shraddha Kapoor walked the ramp in New Delhi for a couture brand's Resonance 2024/25 collection, donning a stunning white lehenga. Discussion online is divided over her walk; some praised her grace, while others found it awkward, suggesting the outfit's weight as a possible cause. Despite mixed reviews, her appearance was widely appreciated. "She, as usual, looks fab, but it seems she is finding it difficult to walk in that lehenga,” a netizen commented.

title: Anees: I made Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 while sitting on one leg
description: Anees Bazmee returns with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3, featuring Kartik Aaryan, Vidya Balan, and Triptii Dimri, amid speculation about Madhuri Dixit-Nene. Despite a severe leg injury before shooting, Bazmee completed most of the film while seated. Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 is set to release on November 1st, clashing with Ajay Devgn and Rohit Shetty's Singham Again.

title: Kareena reveals the most irritating habit about Karisma
description: B-town sisters Kareena Kapoor Khan and Karisma Kapoor share a close bond and are often seen supporting each other publicly. They when not engaging in playful banter they are each other's biggest cheerleaders, leaving no chance to express their admiration for one another's work.

title: Bigg Boss 18 house revealed: From cave-inspired interiors to a hammam-style bathroom!
description: Bigg Boss 18 house takes inspiration from caves and forts, with hidden entrances and earthy tones. The kitchen mimics a cave, while the bedroom feels like a regal fort. A Turkish hammam-style bathroom and secret doors add intrigue to this visually stunning, layered space.

title: YRF appoints Kanupriya as head of talent film strategy
description: YRF Talent has named Kanupriya the Head of Talent Film Strategy. Kanupriya, with over 15 years of industry experience, will lead film strategy and partnerships. Akanksha Malhotra is appointed as AVP of Talent. With 13 years of experience, she will support the film division and foster collaborations for YRF Talent’s actors.

title: Yash Raj Films to release Alpha in December 2025
description: Yash Raj Films announces its first female-led spy film, Alpha, starring Alia Bhatt and Sharvari, set to release in theaters on December 25, 2025. Directed by Shiv Rawail and produced by Aditya Chopra, the film aims to provide an action-packed holiday experience.

title: JioCinema announces appointment of YouTube India head Ishan Chatterjee as chief business officer
description: JioCinema has appointed Ishan Chatterjee as the new Chief Business Officer to enhance its tech-driven digital experience and boost revenue generation in sports and entertainment. With a robust background from YouTube India, Google, McKinsey, and Hindustan Unilever, Ishan will lead monetisation and growth strategies.

title: BookMyShow lodges complaint against black market sale of Coldplay concert tickets, investigation underway
description: BookMyShow has filed a complaint at the Vile Parle Police Station in Mumbai. They report an individual black marketing tickets for Coldplay's January 2025 concert in Navi Mumbai. The company began ticket sales on September 22 and warned against third-party purchases. Some customers tried to buy the maximum number of tickets and collected money from others.

title: Paradox Museum plans experiential centres in more Indian cities
description: The museum offers an immersive experience through optical illusions, featuring 55 paradox-themed exhibits and 15 immersive rooms. The company has already launched its first centre in Mumbai and is planning to expand to Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Chennai and the Delhi-NCR region within the next few years. Before launching in Mumbai, the company opened a centre in London.

title: Media companies to log 8% revenue growth, reaching Rs 60,000 crore by FY27: Crisil
description: Media companies are set to achieve 8% annual revenue growth, reaching Rs 60,000 crore by FY27, driven by digital segment expansion. This includes increased focus on OTT services, social media, and apps, alongside traditional ad revenue growth, improving operating margins to 18% by FY27.

title: Working out issues with CBFC over certificate for 'Emergency' film: Zee Entertainment tells HC
description: Zee Entertainment is in discussions with the Censor Board regarding the certification of 'Emergency', a film directed by Kangana Ranaut. The movie's release faced delays due to objections raised by Sikh organizations. Both parties are working towards a resolution. The court is set to hear the matter again on Friday.

title: ZEEL aims to deliver higher profitability through enhanced performance: MD& CEO Punit Goenka
description: ZEE Entertainment Enterprises Ltd aims to enhance profitability by focusing on frugality, quality content, and optimising performance across its businesses, according to MD & CEO Punit Goenka. The company has proposed workforce reduction and leadership salary cuts, while settling a dispute with Sony Pictures Networks India.

title: After 7 years probe, CBI files closure report in NDTV promoters cheating case
description: The CBI filed a closure report against former NDTV promoters Prannoy Roy and Radhika Roy in a 2009 ICICI Bank loan case, citing lack of legally tenable evidence. The case involved allegations of non-disclosure of pledged shares. NDTV had maintained all loans were repaid and rules followed.

title: Publicis Groupe India's research report shines a spotlight on India's Gen Z
description: Publicis Groupe India has unveiled a study focusing on Gen Z's preferences in media, finance, fashion, health, food, and beverages. The research has highlighted their values as experience seekers, purpose-driven explorers, and health-conscious individuals, emphasising authenticity, quick financial returns, sustainability and holistic well-being.

title: Mukta A2 Cinemas launches festive offer with ₹99 cap on F&B
description: Mukta A2 Cinemas has capped all food and beverage prices at ₹99 for the festive season to make cinema outings more affordable. COO Satwik Lele aims to enhance the overall experience for cinemagoers. This move comes amid industry discussions on high pricing, with average expenditure statistics provided by the Multiplex Association of India.

title: All about Ravi Ahuja who will be Sony Pictures Entertainment's new CEO from January 2, 2025
description: Sony Group Corporation has announced that Tony Vinciquerra will step down as SPE CEO. Ravi Ahuja will take over as the new CEO on January 2, 2025. Vinciquerra will remain as a non-executive Chairman until December 2025. Ahuja looks forward to leading SPE and working with talented colleagues worldwide.

title: Ravi Ahuja to take over as CEO of Sony Pictures as Tony Vinciquerra steps down
description: Tony Vinciquerra will step down as Sony Pictures Entertainment's Chairman and CEO in January 2025. Ravi Ahuja, the current Chairman of Global Television Studios, will take over the role. Vinciquerra will stay in an advisory role until the end of December 2025 while Ahuja will report to Sony Group Corporation's leading executives.

title: Coldplay ticket row: BookMyShow COO appears before EOW
description: Anil Makhija, COO of BookMyShow parent Big Tree Entertainment, appeared before Mumbai Police’s EOW regarding a complaint. The complaint alleges irregularities in ticket sales for Coldplay's India tour, accusing BookMyShow and Live Nation of using ticket bots. BookMyShow denies involvement, emphasizing their measures to ensure fairness.

title: Producers Guild of India re-elects Shibasish Sarkar as president for third term
description: Shibasish Sarkar has been unanimously re-elected as the president of the Producers Guild of India for the third consecutive term during the 69th Annual General Meeting in Mumbai. The meeting also saw the re-election of key Vice Presidents and Treasurers, with discussions on Media & Entertainment industry challenges and opportunities.

title: Coldplay 'fake tickets' row: BookMyShow COO appears before Mumbai police
description: Anil Makhija, COO of Big Tree Entertainment, appears before Mumbai Police’s EOW in the Coldplay concert ticket scam. Allegations claim BookMyShow used bots to hinder genuine purchases, inflating the digital queue and causing fan outrage. CEO Ashish Hemrajani missed his second summon.

title: Reliance's Viacom18-Disney merger: Govt approves transfer of licence to Star India
description: The government has approved the transfer of non-news TV channel licenses from Reliance Industries' Viacom18 to Star India. This move follows the merger approval by NCLT and conditions set by the Competition Commission of India. The combined entity will be India's largest media house, with Reliance holding a majority stake.

title: Viacom18 gets I&B ministry approval to transfer TV channels to Star
description: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has approved the transfer of TV channel licences from Viacom18 to Star India, completing the final step in their merger. This merger, valued at $8.5 billion, will create a media giant with 117 channels across various genres, expected to generate significant cost and revenue synergies.

title: Don't miss these OTT releases this week: Stree 2, Ulajh, Taaza Khabar 2 and more!
description: OTT releases this week: Several new movies and web series are set to premiere on OTT platforms this weekend. Let's explore the titles you can stream online!

title: Yash Chopra’s Birth Anniversary: Must watch films of the legendary filmmaker
description: The master of romance in Indian cinema, Yash Chopra, made a lasting impression with his captivating narrative and endearing characters.

title: 'Ramesh Sippy didn't direct the entire Sholay': Sachin Pilgaonkar reveals Gabbar Amjad Khan and he shot most of the film
description: Actor-director Sachin Pilgaonkar reminisces about working on the iconic film Sholay as an assistant director. He reveals that Ramesh Sippy only directed scenes with main stars, while a second unit handled action sequences. Sachin and Amjad Khan were given the opportunity to represent Sippy for these scenes, enhancing their directorial skills.

title: 'Singham Again', 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' to vie for Diwali box office collections
description: The Hindi film industry is abuzz with the upcoming Diwali clash between 'Singham Again' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3'. Despite concerns about box office cannibalization, producers believe their different genres will attract varied audiences. Industry experts are optimistic, citing the long weekend and lack of major releases in the following weeks.

title: Power & authority come in way of checking spam on OTT platforms
description: DoT and Trai are struggling to curb spam and scams on OTT platforms like WhatsApp, Telegram, and Signal. While WhatsApp is cooperating to some extent, there is little control over Telegram and Signal. Telcos are concerned as their measures do not work on these unregulated platforms.

title: Tata Play Binge powers OTT aggregation platform Cignal Super in Philippines
description: Tata Play Binge is expanding its global reach by providing Platform as a Service to Cignal TV's OTT platform, Cignal Super, in the Philippines. The app, built with Tata Play Binge’s cloud technology, will offer unified access to various OTT services. This follows a similar collaboration with Akash TV in Bangladesh.

title: India on cusp of entertainment revolution driven by tech, diverse content: Kevin Vaz
description: India is on the brink of an entertainment revolution, driven by technology and evolving consumer behavior, says Kevin Vaz, CEO of Broadcast Entertainment at Viacom18. He highlights the growth potential in media consumption and the success of Viacom18's brands like Colors and Nickelodeon, emphasizing the importance of regional content and multi-screen experiences.

title: Multiplex Association defends dynamic ticket pricing, average price in 2023 at Rs 130
description: The Multiplex Association of India (MAI) defended dynamic cinema pricing, which varies based on several factors, in response to filmmaker Karan Johar's remarks on high costs. MAI stated that the average ticket price is Rs 130 and highlighted discounts and promotions that make cinema outings more affordable for families.

title: Paris Fashion Week 2024: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Alia Bhatt, Sonam Kapoor represented India
Lights, camera, legal action: Netflix faces Bollywood drama over Rs 47 crore dispute
description: The Economic Offences Wing of Mumbai Police has initiated a preliminary enquiry following a complaint by Bollywood producer Vashu Bhagnani against a company linked to Netflix and others. Bhagnani alleges cheating and conspiracy over rights for three films, claiming he has not received ₹47.37 crore. Netflix denies the allegations.

title: FDI in I&B sector falls 31% in Q1; Walt Disney tops with ₹2.8k-crore investment
description: The information and broadcasting sector in India saw a 31% decline in foreign direct investment during the first quarter of this financial year, attracting ₹3,374 crore. Major investments included Walt Disney's ₹2,839 crore in Star India and Uday Shankar and James Murdoch's ₹4,306 crore into Viacom18.

title: Oscars 2025: 'Laapataa Ladies' picked as India's entry; how Kiran Rao reacted, top film contenders and other details
Audible, Disney launch three original audio series
description: Audible and Disney Publishing have released three new Audible Originals featuring stories from Frozen, Cars, and Star Wars. These titles join a collection of 60 classic Disney audiobooks available exclusively on Audible. The launch coincides with the introduction of Kids Profiles, allowing parents to share curated audio content in a child-friendly environment.

title: Rs 3.4 lakh for a Coldplay concert ticket? Frustrated fans say 'people are buying to make money, not to attend'
description: Over 1.3 crore Coldplay fans rushed to buy tickets for the band’s Mumbai concerts, resulting in a sell-out of all 1.5 lakh tickets within 30 minutes. Resale platforms took advantage of the demand, with ticket prices soaring up to ₹10 lakh. Fans expressed outrage on social media, highlighting issues with reseller sites and inflated prices. BookMyShow added a third show to address the overwhelming demand but faced ongoing criticism from fans over unfair ticketing practices.

title: Now playing! Second show of movies at theatres near you
description: Re-releasing old films has revitalized theaters, helping exhibitors cover costs and attract audiences. PVR INOX re-released 50 films, generating 60 lakh footfalls and significant revenue. This strategy has proven effective, especially among Generation Z, and will continue when new film releases are limited.

title: Sony India to revamp SET, plug content gap
description: Sony Pictures Networks India, under new CEO Gaurav Banerjee, is revamping Sony Entertainment Television to improve its market share. The channel will focus on enhancing its fiction content while continuing popular non-fiction shows. SPNI also aims to strengthen SAB TV and explore regional TV opportunities for future growth.

title: Now playing! Second show of movies at theatres near you
description: Re-releasing old films has revived theaters, helping exhibitors cover costs and attract audiences. Films like Rockstar, Ghilli, Laila Majnu, and Tumbbad have seen strong responses, generating significant footfalls and boosting food and beverage sales. This strategy has proven effective in the absence of new blockbusters, with re-released films contributing to 4% of annual footfalls at multiplexes.

title: India probing Netflix for visa violations, racial discrimination, email shows
description: India is investigating Netflix's local operations for alleged visa violations, tax evasion, and racial discrimination. The probe follows a government email to a former Netflix executive, Nandini Mehta, who is also suing the company in the U.S. for wrongful termination and discrimination. Netflix claims it is unaware of any investigation.

title: As big-budget films continue to bomb, Bollywood stops shooting for stars; more and more movies shelved
description: The Hindi film industry has seen a rise in shelved big-budget films, with 30-40 projects halted in the past one year and a half. High costs, shifting audience tastes, and stars failing to guarantee strong box-office openings are major factors. Streaming platforms have also reduced investments, impacting producers' revenues.

title: Disney Star secures exclusive rights for T10 global tournaments
description: Disney Star has partnered with T Ten Global to broadcast four major T10 cricket tournaments in India over the next four months. The deal includes coverage of Zim Afro T10, US Masters T10, Abu Dhabi T10, and Lanka T10 in multiple languages. This collaboration aims to bring fast-paced cricket action to Indian fans.

title: Govt wants 30 seconds mandatory anti-tobacco Ad as soon as you open an OTT app, and you can't skip it
description: The Union health ministry has proposed mandatory non-skippable anti-tobacco health spots and audio-visual disclaimers on OTT platforms. These rules, effective from September 1, 2023, require a 30-second spot at the beginning and middle of films and a 20-second disclaimer upon opening the platform.

title: Stree 2, Tumbbad & others attract 60 lakh to theatres in one day to set National Cinema Day record
description: The Multiplex Association of India reported a record turnout on National Cinema Day, with over 60 lakh people attending theatres. The event featured films for Rs 99 per ticket across 4,000 screens. Major releases and regional films drew large crowds, showcasing the enduring appeal of cinema despite recent industry challenges.

title: Asian Cricket Council faces a tough media rights test
description: The Asian Cricket Council's media rights sale for the 2024-31 cycle will be a significant event, with a base price set at $170 million. Major players like Star India, Viacom18, Sony Pictures Networks India, Zee Entertainment, and FanCode are expected to participate. The auction comes amid industry consolidation and budget constraints due to previous commitments to other cricket properties.

title: Corner Office Conversation with Monika Shergill, VP, Content, Netflix India
Israel: Mossad’s daring spy ops that became iconic movie plots
description: Mossad, Israel's renowned intelligence agency, has a storied history of audacious missions that often blur the lines between reality and thriller. From infiltrating enemy territories to orchestrating rescue missions, Mossad's daring tactics have captivated the public and filmmakers alike. This article explores notable films inspired by real-life Mossad missions.

title: Dubai-based GXR acquires media rights to European football leagues for India
description: Galaxy Racer (GXR), a Dubai-based transmedia company, has secured media rights for LaLiga, Serie A, Ligue 1, and Ligue 2 in the Indian subcontinent starting from the 2024/25 season. The matches will be streamed live and free-to-air, enhancing fan engagement through GXR’s innovative Super App.

title: Video on demand category generated $1.04 billion in revenues during H1 2024
description: The premium video-on-demand market in India saw a significant rise in the first half of 2024, generating $1.04 billion in revenues. Local content, especially live sports and dramas, drove engagement. Jio Cinema, Netflix, and Disney+ Hotstar led the revenue charts, with cricket events like IPL and ICC World Cup boosting viewership.

title: Box office pins hopes on festive 'hits' as silver screen fails to dazzle
description: Box-office collections in India for the first eight months of 2024 have dropped by 7.5% compared to last year, due to underperforming films and fewer big releases amid elections and cricket events. However, the second half of the year is expected to see strong performances with anticipated releases like Pushpa 2 and Singham 3.

title: Star claims $940 million damages from ZEE over failed deal
description: Star India, owned by Walt Disney, has sought $940 million in damages from Zee Entertainment for not honoring a $1.5 billion ICC TV rights deal. Zee refuted the claims and stated that arbitration is still in its initial stages. The matter will likely continue post Star's merger with Viacom18.

title: Star files Statement of Case in London court against ZEE, seeks $940 million in damages

Yummm” (When the food from home comes late but makes you happy).

title: Stree 2 needs Rs 5 Cr to hit Rs 600 Cr
description: Shraddha Kapoor and Rajkummar Rao's Stree 2 is close to reaching the Rs 600 crore milestone. The film has grossed Rs 595 crore so far but is seeing a decline in daily collections. With new releases on the way and its release on OTT, it remains to be seen if it will reach the mark.

title: Big B's father said he was a reincarnation of his father
description: Harivanshrai Bachchan had noted in his biography that he believed that his son Amitabh Bachchan was the reincarnation of his father Pratap Narayan Shrivastav. Bachchan was born on October 11, 1942.

title: Alia can't keep calm seeing 'Singham Again' trailer
description: Alia Bhatt is impressed by the trailer of 'Singham Again', the actress says, 'all the dynamite in one frame' after seeing this a glimpse of this huge multi-starrer which is like a blockbuster loading this Diwali!

title: 'Khel Khel Mein' OTT release details
description: 'Khel Khel Mein' is set to begin streaming on OTT from October 9 onwards. The movie stars Akshay Kumar, Fardeen Khan, Taapsee Pannu, Vaani Kapoor, Ammy Virk, Pragya Jaiswal and Aditya Seal. It is directed by Mudassar Aziz.

title: Bhansali: Love And War is NOT 'Sangam' remake
description: Sanjay Leela Bhansali opens up on his highly anticipated movie 'Love And War' with Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor and Vicky Kaushal. The filmmaker revealed that this film is different, it doesn't have those extravagant sets and period setting like his previous projects!

title: Devara inches closer to Rs 250 crore in India
description: 'Devara: Part 1' has now made Rs 248.65 crore in India in all the languages. By the end of Tuesday, the film will cross Rs 250 crore. It stars Jr NTR, Janhvi Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan in lead roles.

title: Movies and Web Series to watch this week
description: This week brings an exciting line-up of movies and series, from supernatural thrillers like 'Stree 2' and spy sagas like 'Citadel: Diana' to the Korean historical action drama 'Uprising' and true crime documentary 'The Menendez Brothers'. With such a diverse range of content across genres, this week’s slate of releases is sure to keep viewers hooked.

title: SLB: Alia locked herself when Inshallah got shelved
description: Alia Bhatt and Sanjay Leela Bhansali have collaborated on 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and now will be teaming up again for 'Love And War'. However, their film 'Inshallah' with Salman Khan got shelved.

title: Cissy Houston passes away at 91
description: Grammy-winning gospel singer Cissy Houston, mother of Whitney Houston, has passed away at 91 in her New Jersey home while under hospice care for Alzheimer's disease. Known for her decades-long music career and contributions to the industry, her death has left fans and family grieving. Social media is flooded with tributes honoring her legacy.

title: SLB talks about crafting emotion in 'Bajirao Mastani'
description: Sanjay Leela Bhansali, known for films like 'Devdas' and 'Bajirao Mastani,' emphasizes capturing emotions through meticulous details in filmmaking. He shares insights on creating iconic scenes by being fully engaged during production. His new project, 'Love And War' with Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Vicky Kaushal, is slated for a March 2026 release.

title: Celebs who got engaged but never tied the knot
description: Abhishek Bachchan-Karisma Kapoor, Salman Khan-Sangeeta Bijlani, Akshay Kumar-Raveena Tandon: Celebs who got engaged but never tied the knot

title: Anushka-Virat, Akshay, Arbaaz-Salman: Top 5 news
description: Get ready for the latest entertainment highlights! Anushka Sharma playfully teased Virat Kohli with her healthy Navratri meal, while Akshay Kumar apologized for missing the Singham Again trailer launch, sending a heartfelt message. Arbaaz Khan humorously reacted to a fan's marriage proposal for Salman Khan. Director Amar Kaushik addressed fan theories about Shraddha Kapoor's character in Stree 2. Lastly, filmmaker Anees Bazmee shared challenges he faced while directing Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3, including a leg injury.

title: Here's why SLB's 'Love And War' will release in 2026
description: Sanjay Leela Bhansali's film 'Love And War' stars Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Vicky Kaushal. Debunking rumors, Bhansali confirms it’s not a remake of 'Sangam'. Set in modern times, he praises the cast and calls the project challenging and significant. The film will be released in March 2026.

title: Kep1er's comeback as a 7-member group
description: Kep1er will release a new album on November 1 after a five-month break. This marks their first comeback as a 7-member group following the departure of Mashiro and Yeseo. They are working with WAKEONE and KLAP Entertainment. Fans are eagerly anticipating how this new dynamic will influence the group's music and performance.

title: Jiyeon's 1st appearance after divorce announcement
description: T-ara's Jiyeon makes her first public appearance post-confirmation of her divorce from baseball player Hwang Jae-gyun at a fan meeting in Macau. The couple, married since December 2022, cited personality differences and filed for divorce mediation with the Seoul Family Court, asking for privacy regarding the matter.

title: NCT's Taeil faces aggravated quasi-rape allegations
description: Taeil from NCT U was investigated for aggravated quasi-rape after allegations he and others sexually assaulted an intoxicated woman in June. The investigation led SM Entertainment to announce his withdrawal from group activities, causing fan outrage and a demand for transparency.

title: Nikita Dutta dances to Shah Rukh's iconic song
description: Nikita Dutta, known for her role in 'Kabir Singh,' danced to Shah Rukh Khan’s 'Mehndi Laga Ke Rakhna' at a sweet shop in Baku, Azerbaijan. The shopkeeper joined in, revealing a playlist of SRK songs. She tweeted about Shah Rukh Khan being a 'universal love language.' Dutta debuted in 2014 and starred in films like 'The Big Bull.'

title: Bhansali:Blessed to be born in 300 square-feet, colourless chawl
description: Sanjay Leela Bhansali reflects on how his challenging upbringing in a small chawl fueled his artistic creativity. He emphasizes the significance of humiliation and chaos in shaping his filmmaking, revealing the deeply personal connection between his past experiences and his cinematic expression.

title: Varun-Maniesh's bromance on ‘Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari’ sets
description: Varun Dhawan and Maniesh Paul's bromance shines in a new video from the sets of 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari.' The clip shows their fun interaction, continuing their dynamic seen in 'Juggjugg Jeeyo.' The film, also starring Janhvi Kapoor and others, releases in 2025.

title: #Concerts trending in I-T dept: Glare on event managers; 11 cos get notices for underreporting of income
description: The Income Tax Department is probing over a dozen event management companies for suspected tax evasion and underreporting of income from overseas performances. Celebrities linked to these companies are also under scrutiny, with 11 companies already receiving notices. The scope of the investigation is expanding.

title: Bharti Airtel in advanced talks to acquire Tata Play to boost digital TV segment
description: Bharti Airtel is in advanced talks to acquire Tata Play, India’s largest DTH business. This move aims to bolster Airtel’s position in the digital TV segment. If successful, it will be the second major deal between Airtel and Tata Group. This acquisition would help Airtel compete with Jio’s aggressive market strategies.

description: The bleak musical drama is on track to open to around $40 million, significantly less than what the 2019 version made on its first weekend.

title: How anti-Hindi protests of the 1960s created India’s most successful regional political movement
description: The agitation proved singular: it toppled a regime, rewrote India’s language policy, and established Dravidian party rule that continues even today.

title: Quincy Jones (1933-2024) showed the world that music speaks one language
description: How an 11-year-old’s break-in birthed eight decades of musical innovation, from Sinatra’s swing to Jackson’s pop revolution.

title: Paradise in Peril: India’s great banyan garden fights for survival
description: The Acharya Jagadish Chandra Bose Indian Botanic Garden, a living heritage site, is in desperate need of funds to sustain itself.

description: His attempt to merge inclusive “Dravidam” philosophy with exclusive “Tamil nationalism” reveals a fundamental misunderstanding of Dravidian politics.

title: Delhi’s Phool Walon Ki Sair: A people’s festival dimmed by bureaucracy
description: It has transformed from a vibrant grassroots celebration into a state-managed affair. Local artisans, flower sellers are mere bystanders now.

title: Safdar Hashmi’s transformative approach to theatre as a democratic force
description: Through plays like Hatyare and Aurat, Hashmi tackled communalism and gender issues while building an inclusive, collaborative artistic practice.

title: Love in the time of ‘love jehad’: The complex lives of Hindu-Muslim couples in India
description: Ashis Roy explores the everyday challenges of urban middle-class Hindu-Muslim couples even as it deftly challenges toxic generalisations.

title: A photograph captured ten novelists who transformed Indian writing forever—and marked the end of an era
description: Revisiting The New Yorker’s iconic 1997 photograph of 10 “original gangsters” of the Indian English novel.

title: Reimagining the past: Inside India’s archive revolution

title: What defines ‘Odia literature’?

title: Could watching a movie change your political views?

title: ChatGPT novels and CG Mona Lisas: The digital deluge of mediocre art threatens to drown out quality work

description: The Chaplin Office in Paris is the guardian of the film icon’s legacy. Decades after his death it is busier than ever.

title: Mir in Americanese

title: New books on the shelves

title: Baba, Bollywood, Bishnoi: A Mumbai murder mystery

title: Can a film be progressive if it is too subtle?

title: Vijay Thalapathy's GOAT: Biggest Tamil grossers of 2024!
description: Tamil Cinema witnessed a slow year, with Thalapathy Vijay's 'The Greatest of All Time' emerging as the top grosser, amassing over Rs 252 crore. Sivakartikeyan's 'Amaran' secured the second position with Rs 189 crore, while Rajinikanth's 'Vettaiyan' and Dhanush's 'Raayan' followed. Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2' disappointed, grossing a mere Rs 81 crore.

title: Roshan on casting SRK-Salman with no ego clash in Karan Arjun
description: In an exclusive conversation with ETimes, Rakesh Roshan opened up on the memories on 'Karan Arjun' as the film releases this coming Friday, November 22. Rakesh Roshan reveals how he wrote the script which managed to convince Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan to star in the movie.

title: Angelina makes rare appearance with youngest son Knox Jolie-Pitt
description: Angelina Jolie graced the Governors Awards in Los Angeles with her son, Knox Jolie-Pitt, by her side. The fifteen-year-old's resemblance to his sister, Shiloh, became a hot topic on social media, with many fans doing double takes. The star-studded event, a prelude to the Oscars, celebrated industry legends like Quincy Jones and James Bond producers Barbara Broccoli and Michael G.

title: Richa shares heartwarming 1st video of daughter
description: Actress Richa Chadha shared a sweet video of her daughter Zuneyra. The video shows Zuneyra playing with toys including a Frida doll. Richa called the video her best collaboration with her husband Ali Fazal. The couple welcomed their daughter in July. Richa and Ali married in 2020. Both actors have been busy with their respective acting careers.

title: DYK Ajay Devgn was offered Vivek's role in Krrish 3
description: Ajay Devgn declined roles in two of Rakesh Roshan's films, 'Karan Arjun' and 'Krrish 3'. Initially agreeing to 'Karan Arjun', Devgn opted out due to personal reasons, paving the way for Salman Khan. He also turned down the antagonist role in 'Krrish 3', expressing discomfort with being killed by another hero on screen.

title: Fans rush to Allu Arjun, Rashmika in Patna; Police resort to lathi charge
description: The grand trailer launch of 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' in Patna turned chaotic as thousands of fans gathered to see stars Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna. Police had to intervene with a "mild" lathi charge as the crowd grew unruly. Despite the commotion, the trailer created a buzz online, offering an action-packed glimpse into the sequel's storyline, featuring Pushpa’s swag and fiery confrontations.

title: Krishna Das praises Anushka-Virat, calls them sincere
description: Bollywood's power couple, Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli, were recently spotted at a spiritual gathering in Mumbai led by renowned spiritual leader Krishna Das. The couple, known for their public displays of affection and commitment, were seen deeply immersed in the devotional singing, further solidifying their image as a spiritually inclined pair. This appearance follows a similar visit by the couple to one of Krishna Das's events in London earlier this year.

title: SS Rajamouli hails 'Pushpa 2' trailer: "Wildfire"
description: The 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' trailer launch in Patna, attended by stars Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna, sparked excitement nationwide. Packed with action, drama, and Pushpa’s trademark swag, the trailer left fans and filmmakers thrilled, including director SS Rajamouli, who expressed his enthusiasm online. With over 10,000 fans attending the event, the sequel promises an explosive continuation of Pushpa’s story, set to release on December 5.

title: Tiger announces 'Baaghi 4' release date with FIRST look
description: Tiger Shroff is gearing up for a grittier return in 'Baaghi 4', hitting theatres on September 5, 2025. The action star promises a 'darker spirit' and 'bloodier mission' in the A Harsha-directed film. The first look poster features a rugged Shroff amidst a backdrop of violence. 'Baaghi 4' marks Harsha's Bollywood debut and might clash with 'The Conjuring: Last Rites'.

title: Amaran outshines Singham Again and Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3
description: Three Diwali film releases are vying for box office dominance. 'Singham Again', 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3', and 'Amaran' have each topped the charts in consecutive weeks. 'Amaran' emerged as the highest grosser this past weekend. The release of Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' on December 5th poses a significant challenge to their continued success.

title: Comedian SLAMMED for joke on Deepika's depression
description: An India's Got Talent contestant is facing backlash for her 'insensitive' joke about Deepika Padukone's struggle with depression. The comedian linked the actress's mental health to motherhood and a past relationship, sparking outrage from netizens and fans alike. Social media users criticized the joke and called it shameful, while fans highlighted the importance of Deepika's advocacy for mental health awareness.

title: When Vikrant sold his phone to return from Goa to Mumbai
description: Vikrant Massey recalls his Goa trip with friends which he did when he had just started earning money but had to sell his phone in order to pay the hotel bill and get return tickets for Mumbai. The actor is currently seen in the recently released film 'The Sabarmati Report'

title: Exploring favourite movies of 'Pushpa' star Allu Arjun
description: Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge, Karan Arjun, Titanic: Exploring favourite movies of 'Pushpa' star Allu Arjun

title: Swara SLAMMED for meeting Maulana Nomani
description: Bollywood actress Swara Bhasker is facing criticism on social media for meeting with Islamic scholar Maulana Sajjad Nomani, who is known for his controversial views against women's education. Netizens are accusing the actress, a vocal advocate for women's rights, of hypocrisy for seeking blessings from someone who opposes her feminist ideology. Bhasker has yet to respond to the online backlash.

title: PM Modi on Sabarmati Report: The truth is coming out
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi reshared a tweet and also praised 'The Sabarmati Report' for bringing out the truth about the Godhra training burning incident. The film stars Vikrant Massey, Raashii Khanna and Riddhi Dogra in lead roles.

title: Swift's London gig cost tax-payers $900,000
description: Taylor Swift's eight sold-out Wembley Stadium concerts came with a hefty security bill, costing London taxpayers nearly $900,000. The pop star's team, led by her mother, demanded increased security measures following a bomb threat at a previous concert. This included a larger police presence and escorts, significantly driving up costs compared to other artists like Harry Styles.

title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' finally beats 'Singham Again'
description: The Vidya Balan, Kartik Aaryan, Madhuri Dixit starrer has made Rs 231 crore in the span of 17 days and finally beaten 'Singham Again' which now stands at Rs 230 crore. Both the movies are now having a neck-to-neck competition with each other. Meanwhile, new release 'The Sabarmati Report' is slowly catching up.

title: Coldplay concert: Hotel prices surge to Rs 1 Lakh
description: Coldplay's upcoming concert in Ahmedabad has sent hotel prices skyrocketing, with some rooms reportedly costing as much as Rs 1 lakh per night. Fans are expressing outrage on social media, while some are attempting to outmanoeuvre the surge by making and cancelling reservations to secure lower rates. However, hotels are catching on and demanding early payments to guarantee bookings.

title: 'Singham Again' hits Rs 230 crore mark in India
description: 'Singham Again' collected Rs 4.15 crore on its third Sunday which was day 17. The total collection of the film is now Rs 230 crore in India. The worldwide gross collection has already crossed Rs 300 crore a while ago.

title: Collective Artists Network expands to the Middle East
description: Collective Artists Network, an Indian talent management agency, has opened an office in Dubai. This expansion aims to connect Indian talent with opportunities in the Middle East. The company will offer services like talent management, brand endorsements, and creator marketing through its digital platform, Big Bang Social.

title: Kangana Ranaut announces release date of 'Emergency' film
description: Kangana Ranaut's film 'Emergency,' based on the life of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, is set to hit theaters on January 17, 2025. The film, also written, directed, and co-produced by Ranaut, faced delays and controversy surrounding its portrayal of historical events.  'Emergency' also stars Anupam Kher, Shreyas Talpade, Mahima Chaudhry, Milind Soman, and the late Satish Kaushik.

title: BARC India sees 44% decline in FY24 profit to Rs 20 crore
description: India's TV audience measurement body, BARC, experienced a 44% profit decline in 2023-24, despite stable revenue.  The firm, reliant on broadcasters for 75% of its income, saw its subsidiary MDPL also face a profit drop.  Despite this, CRISIL reaffirmed BARC's stable rating, citing its strong business model and high revenue visibility, but acknowledged potential impacts from regulatory changes.

title: 65 million viewers: Mike Tyson vs Jake Paul bout gives a KO punch
description: Netflix's first live-streamed sporting event, the boxing match between Mike Tyson and Jake Paul, attracted a peak audience of 65 million viewers globally. However, the event was marred by technical difficulties, with many viewers reporting connection problems and frozen screens. Despite the issues, the event was considered a success by organizers, with Jake Paul proclaiming that they "crashed the site.

title: Dubai-based siblings to transfer jiohotstar.com domain to Reliance 'free of cost'
description: Dubai-based siblings, Jainam and Jivika, have decided to transfer the ownership of the domain 'jiodisneyplushotstar.com' to Reliance for free.  The siblings had purchased the domain from a Delhi-based developer who had initially registered it. Reliance will receive the domain after a formal agreement is signed.

title: Warner Bros, Discovery, NBA reach settlement on TV rights
description: Warner Bros. Discovery and the NBA have resolved their legal battle over broadcasting rights. While Warner Bros. Discovery will no longer air NBA games in the US, the company retains international and digital rights. The deal allows Warner Bros.

title: Miraj Cinemas to launch two additional IMAX screens in the next two years
description: Miraj Cinemas, India's third-largest multiplex chain, is expanding its IMAX footprint with two new screens slated to open in 2025 and 2026. This follows the recent reopening of their renovated IMAX multiplex in Wadala, Mumbai.  The company aims to meet the increasing demand for premium entertainment experiences across the country.

title: FICCI, GDAI sign MoU to bolster India’s video gaming industry
description: The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) and the Game Developers Association of India (GDAI) joined forces at IGDC 2024 to bolster India's burgeoning video game industry.  Their partnership will focus on creating industry-friendly policies, fostering knowledge exchange, and promoting skill development to establish India as a global gaming leader.

title: Disney incurs $1.5-b impairment charge on Star India deal in FY24
description: Walt Disney reported a $1.5 billion impairment charge related to its Star India transaction, reflecting a fair value adjustment. The charge includes $800 million in cumulative foreign currency translation losses. Disney completed the merger of Star India with Reliance Industries' Viacom18, creating JioStar, on November 14.

title: Govt clears consideration of private member's Bill on independent media licensing authority
description: A private member's bill proposing the establishment of an independent body to regulate media licensing in India has been cleared for consideration by the Rajya Sabha. The bill, introduced by CPI(M) MP V Sivadasan, aims to ensure a free and independent media landscape by transferring licensing authority from the government to an autonomous entity, the Indian Board of Media Services.

title: Merger concludes! Viacom18-Star India valued at Rs 70,000 cr
description: Viacom18 and Star India have merged to create India's largest media and entertainment company. The new entity is valued at $8.5 billion. Reliance Industries and The Walt Disney Company received regulatory approvals for the merger. The combined company will be called Jio Star. Jio Star will have over 100 TV channels and two streaming platforms, JioCinema and Hotstar.

title: JioStar unveils leadership team of combined entity
description: JioStar, the newly merged entity of Star India and Viacom18, has unveiled its leadership team under the guidance of chairperson Nita Ambani and vice-chairperson Uday Shankar.  The team, spearheaded by co-CEOs Kevin Vaz, Kiran Mani, and Sanjog Gupta, aims to drive innovation and growth across entertainment, digital, and sports sectors.

title: RIL, Viacom18 and Disney complete merger to create a Rs 70,352 cr JV
description: Reliance Industries Limited, Viacom18, and The Walt Disney Company have finalized the merger of Viacom18's media and JioCinema businesses with Star India. The newly formed venture, valued at approximately US$8.5 billion, brings together popular brands like 'Star', 'Colors', 'JioCinema', and 'Hotstar' under a single umbrella.

title: Expression of Interest issued for setting up FM radio stations in 234 uncovered towns: Official
description: The Indian government is auctioning FM radio channels in 234 towns, aiming to expand radio coverage.  Interested parties have until November 18 to submit applications.  Additionally, an Indian Institute of Creative Technologies will be established in Mumbai to foster growth in the gaming industry.

title: Star India posts Rs 12,548 crore loss in FY24 on provision against onerous ICC contract
description: Star India reported a significant loss for the last financial year. The broadcaster attributed this to a provision made for a challenging contract related to ICC media rights. Star India had acquired these rights for a substantial sum but faced setbacks. Zee Entertainment backed out of a sub-licensing agreement, leading to arbitration.

title: Star India to make web series on Reserve Bank
description: Star India has won a bid to create a five-episode web series about the Reserve Bank of India's 90-year history. The series, commissioned for Rs 6.5 crore, will highlight the central bank's role in India's economic growth and aims to enhance public understanding of its functions and policies.

title: Media consumption in rural India is becoming increasingly hybrid: GroupM-Kantar
description: Rural India is experiencing a surge in hybrid media consumption, with consumers increasingly utilizing both online and offline channels. This shift is driven by rising internet penetration and digital adoption, leading to a significant increase in the use of digital services and a growing preference for lifestyle-oriented content.

title: Disney Star's distribution head Gurjeev Kapoor leaves before Reliance-Star India merger: Sources
description: Gurjeev Kapoor, Disney Star's Head of Distribution and International Markets, is leaving the company. His departure comes as Reliance and Disney's $8.5 billion merger in India nears completion. Kapoor chose to pursue entrepreneurial ventures instead of joining the Viacom18/Disney Star venture.

title: Does the strategy of focusing more on premium audiences pay rich dividends to exhibitors?
description: The Indian exhibition industry is experimenting with pricing strategies to attract audiences back to theaters.  Capped ticket prices on special days and for re-releases have led to increased footfalls and box office success. This suggests that affordable pricing, rather than a sole focus on premium experiences, might be key to reviving the industry and attracting a wider audience.

title: India emerging as good opportunity market for Sony's gaming biz, says India MD
description: Sony India, experiencing substantial growth in its gaming sector due to the PlayStation 5's success, is now eyeing India as a key market. Despite anticipating moderated growth this fiscal year, the company remains committed to expanding its gaming presence, including software and peripherals.

title: Sony's PS5 Pro to give India a miss
description: Sony Playstation 5 Pro will not launch in India. The console uses Wi-Fi 7 which needs the 6GHz band. India has not yet allowed the 6GHz band for commercial use. The band is currently used by ISRO and there is a debate on who should get access to it.

title: JioCinema business head Ferzad Palia to step down
description: Ferzad Palia, the Business Head of JioCinema, is stepping down from his position after a long tenure at Viacom18. Palia played a crucial role in JioCinema's growth, leading the platform to achieve 20 million paid subscribers and 250 million monthly active users. He will remain with the organization during a transition period to ensure a smooth handover.

title: From Buckingham Murders to Citadel: 5 fresh OTT releases for your weekend binge watch
description: Get ready for an exciting lineup on OTT platforms this week, with new releases on Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, Disney+ Hotstar, and more. Here's your guide to the must-watch content streaming across platforms this week.

title: With Coldplay’s India tour….: BookMyShow reacts to black marketing of tickets
description: BookMyShow is committed to bringing major global events to India, including Coldplay’s India tour, Maroon 5’s performance, and Lollapalooza India, according to a company statement. Along with supporting law enforcement in investigations related to ticket scalping, BookMyShow has filed an FIR against the black marketing of tickets for high-demand events.

title: Sony Pictures Networks India appoints Sibaji Biswas as CFO
description: Sony Pictures Networks India (SPNI) has appointed Sibaji Biswas as their new Chief Financial Officer. Bringing over 20 years of experience, Biswas will be responsible for SPNI's financial strategies and operations. His previous role at Syngene International saw him play a key role in the company's expansion and digital transformation.

title: Blocked by Canada, 'The Australia Today' says will "continue to advocate for open media"
description: Jitarth Jai Bharadwaj, the Managing Editor of 'Australia Today' said in the statement that they would continue to advocate for an open media.

title: Premier League looking for media partners in India
description: The Premier League's media rights deal with Star India is ending. Star India is not renewing the contract. The Premier League is looking for new partners in India. Sony Pictures Networks India and others have been approached. The Premier League is open to selling different packages. The value of media rights has declined in recent years.

title: After fireworks, big budget movies fizzle at the box office on unfavourable reviews
description: According to early reports from Sacnilk, the Diwali releases Singham Again and Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 have seen a steady decline in box-office collections over the past six days. Both films opened strongly, earning about Rs 43.5 crore and ?35.5 crore, respectively on Friday. However, by Sunday, collections had dipped to about Rs 35.75 crore and Rs 33.5 crore. The downward trend continued, with the films' earnings dropping to about Rs 10.25 crore and Rs 10.5 crore by Wednesday.

title: Film Producer Tutu Sharma to launch multiplex chain Citara in tier-II and tier-III cities
description: Film producer Tutu Sharma is launching Citara, a multiplex chain targeting tier-II and tier-III cities in India. The chain will offer tickets at 30-40% cheaper prices than the industry average, aiming to cater to the entertainment needs of these cities with affordable moviegoing experiences.

title: Weekend dhamaka at Box Office: Collections from Singham Again, Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 top Rs 230 cr, lift exhibitors’ hopes
description: The Diwali weekend saw the release of two big-budget Bollywood films, 'Singham Again' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3', which brought in a collective ₹231.4 crore. While both films opened strong, Sunday saw a dip in collections.  Exhibitors are now looking at Monday and Tuesday's performance to determine future screening strategies.

title: DTH players' FY24 revenue down amid major subscriber loss
description: Indian private DTH operators Tata Play, Bharti Telemedia, Dish TV, and Sun Direct experienced a 5% revenue decline amid a consumer shift to digital platforms. Bharti Telemedia was the only provider to show revenue growth. The industry faced significant subscriber losses, and consolidation discussions have intensified.

title: Why community-building is key to creator success today
description: Instagram's broadcast channels enable creators to share content directly with followers, reducing the stress of staying relevant. These channels foster deeper connections by allowing unfiltered interactions and catering to niche topics. Creators are realising the importance of building small, loyal communities that can follow them across platforms, increasing engagement and opportunity.

title: 'Singham Again' roars at box office, collects over Rs 43 crore on Day 1
description: Diwali festival brought a box office clash between 'Singham Again' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3'. 'Singham Again', directed by Rohit Shetty, earned Rs 43.70 crore on day 1, surpassing 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3', which earned Rs 36.60 crore. Both films contributed to a record single-day box office of Rs 124 crore the highest in Indian cinema history.

title: Netflix India sees double-digit growth in revenue, profit for FY24
description: Netflix India's net profit rose 49% to Rs 52 crore in the last fiscal year, driven by a growing subscriber base and content expansion. The company's gross turnover reached Rs 2,845 crore, while expenses increased but were offset by a rise in subscribers, propelled by new mobile plans and a crackdown on password sharing.

title: Singham Again vs Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3: Exhibitors bet on horror, action this Diwali
description: With "Singham Again" and "Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3" both releasing this Diwali, exhibitors anticipate recovering losses with their joint 6,000 screen presence. Trade experts predict a stronger opening for "Singham Again" with anticipated collections of Rs 40-45 crore, overshadowing the Rs 20-25 crore expectation for "Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3".

title: European Commission clears Reliance-Disney merger deal
description: The European Commission approved a joint venture between Reliance Industries, Walt Disney, and BTS Investment. This will create India's largest media conglomerate, valued at $8.5 billion. The merger will include over 100 TV channels and two streaming platforms. Reliance will hold a controlling stake, and the merger is expected to be finalized in early November.

title: Sound, School and Studio: How Indie artist Rohan Solomon is building a musician's dream space
Ayushmann Khurrana joins Birla Brainiacs as investor, brand ambassador
description: Bollywood star Ayushmann Khurrana has invested in Techybrid ThinkTank and is the brand ambassador for Birla Brainiacs. Founded by Nirvaan Birla, this platform offers hybrid homeschooling, integrating online and offline learning. Ayushmann's involvement aims to revolutionize education in India, combining traditional academics with essential life skills for a future-ready learning experience.

title: Disney Star likely to lose Mihir Rale post Reliance merger
description: Mihir Rale, Chief Regional Counsel at Disney Star, is likely stepping down amid the $8.5 billion merger between Reliance and Disney’s Indian media operations, sources told ET Online. The merger will create India’s largest media conglomerate and consolidate live sports streaming on Disney+ Hotstar.

title: Airtel makes internal management rejig
description: Bharti Airtel is restructuring its Direct-to-home (DTH) business into two new verticals: Connected Homes and DTH. Siddharth Sharma will lead Connected Homes, while Gujral will head DTH. The Customer Experience unit will become a standalone function led by Shivan Bhargava. Amit Tripathi takes on Market Operations, all reporting to MD and CEO Shashwat Sharma. Changes take effect April 1, 2025.

title: Bankruptcy court rejects plea to implement Zee-Sony merger
description: The Mumbai bankruptcy court dismissed Phantom Studios India's application to enforce a merger between Zee Entertainment and Sony entities, as the companies' boards had already withdrawn the scheme. The tribunal emphasized that the minor shareholder's enforcement rights lapsed after board approval. The parties had previously agreed to a non-cash settlement, ending their disputes.

title: India next billion-user market for Warner Music: CEO Robert Kyncl
description: Warner Music Group is focusing on expanding in India, seeing it as a prime market alongside China. Encouraging local teams to speed up deals, Warner has made several acquisitions and aims to promote regional music globally. India's growing internet and smartphone user base are seen as key factors in this strategy.

title: Zee Entertainment reinstates increments from September 1
description: Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited has reinstated salary increments effective September 1, 2024, after a previous 15% workforce reduction. A portion of this increment is already factored into Q2 results. Despite this, ZEEL's employee benefits expense decreased by 12%. The company aims for a 20% EBITDA margin by FY26, involving cost optimizations and personnel restructuring.

title: Nikhil Kamath, Stride Ventures acquire minority stakes in media-tech firm Streambox Media
description: Micromax now holds the majority stake in Streambox, while Ishpreet Singh Gandhi holds a significant minority. Streambox aims to launch a connected TV service called Dor and a TV operating system to enhance content discovery. Smart TVs are replacing traditional TVs, and streaming services are growing rapidly in major cities.

title: Disney Hotstar head Sivanandan said to have resigned after India merger with Reliance

This move comes as the newly merged entity decides to stream all live sporting events on Hotstar, including the Indian Premier League (IPL).

title: Twitter India's FY24 net tanks 90% amid falling ad revenue
description: Twitter Communications India, now X Corp, saw a 90% decline in net profit and revenue last financial year. This was after Elon Musk's takeover led to mass layoffs, including the ad sales team. Advertising revenue in India, a major income source, plummeted, reflecting broader global challenges under Musk's leadership.

title: Indian entertainment industry loses Rs 22,400 crore annually due to piracy: EY-IAMAI

title: RIL-Disney to divest seven channels, won't bundle ad slots for cricket

They will sell seven TV channels and unbundle ad slots for major cricket events to address antitrust issues. The merger is set to finalize in early November, creating India's largest entertainment company with Nita Ambani and Uday Shankar as the leaders.

title: Reliance-Disney media giant may be born in November
description: The merger between RIL's Viacom18 and Disney's Star India will conclude in early November. This will form India's largest media conglomerate, valued at $8.5 billion. Viacom18 will transfer assets to Star India, creating an entity with over 100 TV channels and two streaming platforms. Kevin Vaz and Kiran Mani will be co-CEOs.

title: Reliance-Disney merger: CCI publishes detailed order, 7 channels including Hungama & Super Hungama, to be sold
description: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved the merger of Reliance Industries-promoted Viacom18 and Walt Disney-owned Star India, which will create India's largest media and entertainment firm. To comply with CCI stipulations, seven TV channels, including Hungama and Super Hungama, will be sold. The merger will not allow bundling of TV ad slots for cricket rights until current agreements expire.
